alternative_parents.description: Ester derivatives of alpha amino acids.
alternative_parents.name: Alpha amino acid esters

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing alanine or a derivative thereof resulting from reaction of alanine at the amino group or the carboxy group, or from the replacement of any hydrogen of glycine by a heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Alanine and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds that contain a m-xylene moiety, which is a monocyclic benzene carrying exactly two methyl groups at the 1- and 3-positions.
alternative_parents.name: m-Xylenes

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a furan ring, which carries a carboxyl group or a derivative thereof.
alternative_parents.name: Furoic acid and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a heteroaromatic ring that carries a carboxamide group.
alternative_parents.name: 2-heteroaryl carboxamides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an amide derivative of carboxylic acid, with the general structure RN(R1)C(R2)=O (R1-R2 any atom but H).
alternative_parents.name: Tertiary carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carboxyl group that is esterified with a methyl group. They have the general structure RC(=O)OR', where R=H or organyl group and R'=methyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Methyl esters

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acids containing exactly one carboxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Monocarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

class.description: Aromatic compounds containing one monocyclic ring system consisting of benzene.
class.name: Benzene and substituted derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as 2-furanilides. These are aromatic heterocyclic compounds contaning a furan ring that is substituted at the 2-position with an anilide.

direct_parent.description: Aromatic heterocyclic compounds contaning a furan ring that is substituted at the 2-position with an anilide.
direct_parent.name: 2-furanilides

intermediate_nodes.description: Aromatic compounds containing an anilide group in which the carboxamide group is substituted with an aromatic group. They have the general structure RNC(=O)R', where R= benzene, and R = aryl group.
intermediate_nodes.name: Aromatic anilides

intermediate_nodes.description: Aromatic anilides with the general structure RC(=O)N(R')R\", where R=furan, and R\"=benzene.
intermediate_nodes.name: Furanilides

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic heterocyclic compounds derived from oxoacids RkE(=O)l(OH)m (l not 0) by replacing an OH group by the NHPh group or derivative formed by ring substitution.
subclass.name: Anilides

superclass.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
superclass.name: Benzenoids
